full_summary:
# Parks Canada Radio Dispatch Upgrade Project – Banff and Jasper National Parks

## Invitation to Bid

The Parks Canada Agency invites qualified contractors to submit bids for the Radio Dispatch Upgrade Project – Banff and Jasper National Parks. This project involves upgrading the radio dispatch system at two independent emergency dispatch centers.

## Project Overview

The objective of this project is to replace two outdated Zetron 4000 dispatch systems with a modern IP-based dispatch system. The new system will integrate with various external IP-based interfaces across multiple locations, enhancing operational efficiency and capacity. The implementation will be done in two phases: one for Banff and one for Jasper.

## Competitive Solicitation

The procurement method is Competitive – Open Bidding. Bidders will be selected based on a combined rating of technical merit and price. The selection criteria will be outlined in the solicitation document.

## Tender Requirements

* The tender response must be submitted via email or fax to the designated address: soumissionsouest-bidswest@canada.ca or (1-866) 246-6893.
* The maximum file size for email submissions is 15 MB. Bidders should ensure that attachments, including the bid document, do not exceed this size.
* Emails with links to bid documents will not be accepted. Bid documents must be sent as attachments.
* Bidders are responsible for any issues related to file size or transmission.

## Important Dates

- Tender submission deadline: August 24, 2023, 4:00 PM Mountain Standard Time
- Expected contract start date: September 15, 2023
- Expected contract end date: November 30, 2026

## Contact Information

For technical and contractual inquiries, please contact Ryan Taylor at ryan.taylor@pc.gc.ca or (587) 436-5987.

## Notice and Bidding Instructions

Please refer to the solicitation document for detailed information on the bidding process and requirements. Bidders are responsible for ensuring they meet the specified requirements and deadlines.

The Government Electronics Tendering Service (GETS) is the official source for tender notices and documents. Bidders are encouraged to access the GETS website for the latest information on this project.

By [Your Name] on August 24, 2023
